intro: Krascheninnikovia ceratoides, commonly known as the silvergrass or sand grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a perennial grass that thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. The plant has narrow, silver-blue leaves that help reduce water loss through transpiration. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, pale green to brown flowers. Krascheninnikovia ceratoides plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitats.
